title: Circular motion - point with greatest speed

content.question: A motor swings a ball on a string in a vertical circle such that the tension in the string is constant throughout the ball’s motion. Which of the following correctly indicates at which point the ball has the greatest speed and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: At the topmost point, because the tension force and gravitational force are both directed toward the center of the ball’s motion.
At the topmost point, because the net force on the ball is zero.
At the bottommost point, because the tension offsets the gravitational force.
At the bottommost point, because the net force on the ball is a maximum.

content.answer: At the topmost point, because the tension force and gravitational force are both directed toward the center of the ball’s motion.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
